page.title: 18FARMING IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Only one farm exists in this area, comprising 993 acres. The Department of the Environment is the landlord. The farm forms part of the Army training ground and is split into two categories; Schedule I on which the tenant may farm in the normal way and Schedule III which has a grazing licence only and on which the Army trains. The greater acreage is grazing from which silage and hay are taken during the summer months and on which sheep from the Welsh mountains are over wintered from November to April. Schedule I comprises 438 acres of which much is ley pasture. Crops grown are barley and wheat. There is a seventy cow dairy, and beef bulls are used to produce store cattle which are sold in Shaftesbury market. Five men are employed on the farm.
